creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Panel of gold k'ossu with two seated five-clawed dragons in green, partially woven with peacock feathers. In the field loose, rather fat clouds in shades of blue, green, orange, brown, red, and pink. Below, waves and sacred mountain, the latter a restoration in painted k'ossu. In the waves are symbols of the Eight Precious Things. Triple applied border narrow binding of red satin; strip of green and gold brocade; main border of mulberry satin brocade with diaper of flowered lozenges and octagons which is bound in turn with a narrow stipe of blue satin brocade. Lining of gold colored satin damask of cloud pattern.
title: Panel
